SEARCH
Package com.flaviolcord.user.registry.util

Class SensitiveDataSanitizer

java.lang.Object
com.flaviolcord.user.registry.util.SensitiveDataSanitizer
public class SensitiveDataSanitizer extends Object
Utility class for sanitizing sensitive data from objects, strings, collections, and arrays. It provides methods to mask or truncate sensitive information, such as personal details, to ensure data security and privacy.

This class is particularly useful for logging or displaying data without exposing sensitive information such as phone numbers, user details, or gender.

Examples of sanitization:

  • Phone numbers are masked to hide all but the last four digits.
  • Strings are truncated or replaced with placeholders when sensitive.
  • Custom objects containing sensitive fields are sanitized recursively.

Thread Safety: This class is thread-safe as it operates only on provided inputs without maintaining any state.

  • Constructor Details

    • SensitiveDataSanitizer

      private SensitiveDataSanitizer()
      Default constructor for SensitiveDataSanitizer.

      This constructor is intentionally private, as this class is a utility class with only static methods and does not require any instance initialization.

  • Method Details

    • sanitizeArgs

      public static String sanitizeArgs(Object[] args)
      Sanitizes an array of objects by applying appropriate sanitization rules to each element.
      Parameters:
      args - the array of objects to sanitize; can contain null, collections, arrays, or other objects
      Returns:
      a string representation of the sanitized array, with elements separated by commas and enclosed in square brackets

    • sanitizeArg

      public static String sanitizeArg(Object arg)
      Sanitizes a single object by applying sanitization rules based on its type.

      Supported types include:

      • String: Strings are masked or truncated based on their content.
      • Collection: Elements in the collection are sanitized recursively.
      • Arrays: Elements are sanitized recursively.
      • LocalDate: Dates are normalized to display only the year.
      • Custom objects: Fields of sensitive objects are sanitized recursively.

      Parameters:
      arg - the object to sanitize
      Returns:
      a sanitized string representation of the object

    • sanitizeString

      private static String sanitizeString(String str)
      Masks sensitive strings.
      • Gender strings ("Male", "Female", "Other") are replaced with "***".
      • Phone numbers with 10 or more digits are masked, showing only the last 4 digits.
      • Other strings are truncated or replaced with placeholders.
      Parameters:
      str - the string to sanitize
      Returns:
      a sanitized version of the string

    • maskPhoneNumber

      private static String maskPhoneNumber(String phoneNumber)
      Masks a phone number, leaving only the last four digits visible.
      Parameters:
      phoneNumber - the phone number to mask
      Returns:
      the masked phone number

    • sanitizeDate

      private static String sanitizeDate(LocalDate date)
      Normalizes a LocalDate by displaying only the year, with the month and day set to 01-01.
      Parameters:
      date - the date to sanitize
      Returns:
      a sanitized string representation of the date

    • isSensitiveObject

      private static boolean isSensitiveObject(Object obj)
      Checks if an object is considered sensitive based on its class name.

      Objects are considered sensitive if their class name contains the term "User".

      Parameters:
      obj - the object to check
      Returns:
      true if the object is considered sensitive; false otherwise

    • sanitizeSensitiveObject

      private static String sanitizeSensitiveObject(Object obj)
      Sanitizes a custom object by sanitizing all its fields recursively.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to sanitize
      Returns:
      a sanitized string representation of the object, with fields and their values

    • truncate

      private static String truncate(String str)
      Truncates a string to the specified maximum length and appends "..." if the string exceeds the maximum length (100).
      Parameters:
      str - the string to truncate
      Returns:
      the truncated string
